divs: sighting detailsmy family and i live in a rural area off of hwy 270 near a heavily wooded area. this event happened in the northern sky which from my backyard is directly facing a hill. i was outside grilling hamburgers at night and was almost finished when i decided to sit on my porch steps for the last 5 minutes or so and look at the sky. it was very clear that night and the stars had recently began appearing. i looked up and noticed a light that seemed brighter than any other planet or star should and did not put off the typical light a common aircraft would. the light had a blue tint to it and seemed to be more of a glow. it was roughly the same altitude as any plane would fly in the area but i noticed that i wasn't hearing any noise from it at all. i continued to watch it move eastward for about another minute and also found it weird that there were no flashing lights like airplanes have. so i opened my back door and grabbed a pair of binoculars that i keep next to our kitchen window and went back outside to my porch. i spotted the object again still moving in the same direction and focused in on it. it appeared almost ball-like and the light was eminating out of about 2\3 of the top towards the back of the craft at a upwards angle. (think of holding a flashlight at a 45 degree angle pointing up) at this point i noticed that i was correct that it was missing the clearance lights (or whatever those flashing ligthts are called) and i wanted to adjust my binoculars a bit so i took them down. after fixing them i spotted it again. it hadn't moved very far at all and was about the same size in the sky as previously. probably took about ten-fifteen seconds to adjust lenses. but when i tried to find it in my binoculars i couldn't. once again i lowered them, and found it with my eyes, tried to put the binoculars back on it and couldn't. i looked through them for about 10 seconds and when i took them down again the object was gone. it wasn't that it had traveled so far that it became too small to see. it had simply dissappeared. i felt really excited about it and at this point i went inside and told my wife what i had just saw.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Red Oak
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Bluish glowing object sighted in Northern sky.
